title: Putin Raises Stakes in the War, With Direct Challenge to the West
description: The Russian leader announced a call-up of troops and hinted at using nuclear weapons, accusing the West of trying to “destroy our country” and vowing that Russia would defend itself.

title: Biden Paints Russia as a Threat to the World in U.N. Speech
description: President Biden portrayed Russia as the chief threat to global peace and renewed warnings that “a nuclear war cannot be won.”

title: In U.N. General Assembly Address, Zelensky Says, ‘Russia Should Pay for This War’
description: “A crime has been committed against Ukraine, and we demand just punishment,” President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said in a recorded speech to the U.N. General Assembly.

title: Russia releases 215 fighters, including Mariupol commanders, in a prisoner exchange.
description: The exchange, the war’s largest, included Viktor Medvechuk, a Ukrainian oligarch and close friend of the Russian president.

title: Washington Pays Tribute to a Different Type of Leader
description: Politicians and diplomats, including Vice President Kamala Harris, paid their respects to Queen Elizabeth II at a memorial service in Washington, D.C.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Russia’s ‘Partial Mobilization’
description: Plus protests in Iran intensify and New York State sues Donald Trump for fraud.

title: Biden Criticizes Iran and China on Human Rights and Security Issues
description: President Biden said that Washington “will be unabashed in promoting” a vision of a free world.

title: Senate Ratifies Kigali Amendment, the Global Pact to Curb Hydrofluorocarbons
description: In a bipartisan vote, lawmakers voted to join an international agreement to phase out the hydrofluorocarbons commonly found in refrigerators and air-conditioners.

title: E.U. countries ask the U.N to appoint a monitor to assess human rights violations in Russia.
One-Way Flights From Russia Are Selling Out or Skyrocketing in Price
description: Some Russians rushed to buy airfare after President Vladimir V. Putin ordered up reservists to bolster the country’s military in Ukraine. Tickets to some visa-free destinations are sold out for several days.

title: Ten Prisoners, Including Americans, Have Been Released in a Russia-Ukraine Exchange
description: Alex Drueke, a former U.S. Army staff sergeant who served two tours in Iraq, and Andy Tai Ngoc Huynh, a former U.S. Marine, were released.

title: For Churches, Abortion Politics Is a Double-Edged Sword
description: Ireland and Poland went in entirely opposite directions on abortion. Why?

title: President Raisi Addresses U.N. General Assembly Amid Protests in Iran
description: “We are the defenders of a fight against injustice,” President Ebrahim Raisi told the U.N. General Assembly as his government faces widespread protests over the rights of women.

title: Germany’s chancellor calls Putin ‘desperate.’
John Train, Paris Review Co-Founder and Cold War Operative, Dies at 94
description: His career, ranging from literature to finance to war, and from France to Afghanistan, seemed to cover every interest and issue of his exalted social class.

title: Protests Intensify in Iran Over Woman Who Died in Custody
description: Unrest has spread to dozens of cities, with at least seven people killed, according to witnesses, rights groups and video posted on social media.

title: Book Review: ‘The Story of Russia’ by Orlando Figes
description: In a new book, the historian Orlando Figes argues that the war on Ukraine is only the latest instance of a nation twisting the past to justify its future.

title: How ‘Lord of the Rings’ Inspires Italy’s Giorgia Meloni
description: Giorgia Meloni, the nationalist politician who is the front-runner to become prime minister, sees “The Lord of the Rings” as not just a series of novels, but also a sacred text.

title: The Theater at War
description: In shows like “The Burnt City,” the chaos of war meets the curated artifice of performance, our critic writes. But “Oresteia” took a different view, and the audience was better for it.

title: U.N. Updates: Biden to Address General Assembly on Day of Ukraine Debates
description: World leaders, including the presidents of Ukraine and Iran, are due to discuss the war in Ukraine, food and energy crises, and climate change.

title: Analysis: A Cornered Putin Is More Dangerous Than Ever
description: In a major speech, he recast the war in Ukraine and made clear that it could spread.

title: Iran’s President Speaks at U.N. as Protests Rock His Nation
description: The Iranian president, who came to power last year, will address the assembly amid large demonstrations at home and international pressure to revive the Iran nuclear deal.

title: German Far-Right Politicians Cancel Trip to Russian-Occupied Part of Donbas
description: The planned visit by state politicians of the Alternative for Germany party was controversial, with critics saying it would chip away at national unity over Ukraine.

title: Ukrainian officials cast Putin’s order as an act of desperation.
China offers a muted response to Putin’s announcement as it tries to maintain ties to Russia.
French Left Lawmaker Admits Slapping Wife, and Party Leader Defends Him
description: Jean-Luc Mélenchon, the leader of the leftist France Unbowed party, expressed “trust” and “affection” for Adrien Quatennens, setting off a firestorm.

title: A Shrinking Margin
description: Democrats lost ground with Hispanic voters in 2020. It doesn’t seem to have been a blip.

title: Ukraine Live Updates: Putin Calls Up More Troops as His War Effort Falters
description: In a rare address to the nation, the Russian president railed against the West for providing Ukraine with weapons and made a veiled threat of using nuclear weapons. Russia’s defense minister put the number of new call-ups at 300,000.

title: On a Grim Anniversary, 230 Pilot Whales Are Stranded in Tasmania
description: “At least 95 percent will die, because the ocean’s just so fierce,” said a boat skipper on the scene, where 470 whales were also beached in 2020.

title: German Government Nationalizes Uniper in Move to Secure Energy Supply
description: The utility company, once Germany’s largest importer of Russian gas, has been squeezed since Moscow cut the flow of the fuel, leading to a partial bailout in July that is now a full takeover.

title: Global leaders condemn planned referendums in Russian-occupied parts of Ukraine.
Victims Recall Life in the Philippines Under Marcos’s Martial Law
description: Ferdinand E. Marcos placed the country under military rule 50 years ago this week. With his son now in power, those who lived through those dark days fear their stories will be lost.

title: Russia’s gas cutoff is ravaging manufacturers in Europe.
Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Here’s what you need to know.
